Scraping fishing nets over an electricity cable laid on or in the seabed is dangerous.
Fishing nets in the water column and over the seabed at an operational oil or gas extraction platform are dangerous.
Scraping fishing nets over a pipeline laid on or in the seabed is dangerous.
Scraping fishing nets over the seabed at a tidal farm is dangerous.
Scraping fishing nets over the seabed at a wave farm is dangerous.
Scraping fishing nets over the seabed at a wind farm is dangerous.
Scraping fishing nets over the seabed at an ammunition dump is dangerous.
Scraping fishing nets over a telecom cable laid on or in the seabed is dangerous.
Bottom trawlers always steer clear of known or popular cargo vessel routes.
Bottom trawlers always steer clear of known or popular ferry routes.
Bottom trawlers always steer clear of known or popular maintenance vessel routes.
Bottom trawlers always steer clear of known or popular passenger vessel routes.
Bottom trawlers always steer clear of known or popular tanker vessel routes.
Bottom trawlers never fish right next to or just outside of ports, they sail out a bit first.
If desired, bottom trawling can be banned from operating in a particular Marine Protected Area.
Fishing nets in the water column during construction of an electricity cable are dangerous. Non-existent once completed.
Fishing nets in the water column at an operational oil or gas extraction platform are dangerous.
Fishing nets in the water column during construction of a pipeline are dangerous. Non-existent once completed.
Fishing nets in the water column at a tidal farm are dangerous.
Fishing nets in the water column at a wave farm are dangerous.
Fishing nets in the water column at a wind farm are dangerous.
Fishing nets in the water column during construction of a telecom cable are dangerous. Non-existent once completed.

Industrial & pelagic always steer clear of known or popular ferry routes.
Industrial & pelagic trawlers always steer clear of known or popular maintenance vessel routes.
Industrial & pelagic trawlers always steer clear of known or popular passenger vessel routes.
Industrial & pelagic trawlers always steer clear of known or popular tanker vessel routes.
Industrial & pelagic trawlers never fish right next to or just outside of ports, they sail out a bit first.
If desired, industrial & pelagic trawling can be banned from operating in a particular Marine Protected Area.

Drift & fixed nets in the water column at a wave farm are dangerous.
Drift & fixed nets in the water column during construction of a wind farm are dangerous. Non-existent once completed.
Drift & fixed nets in the water column during construction of a telecom cable are dangerous. Non-existent once completed.

Drift & fixed net fishers always steer clear of known or popular tanker vessel routes.
Drift & fixed net fishers never fish right next to or just outside of ports, they sail out a bit first.
If desired, drift & fixed net fishers can be banned from operating in a particular Marine Protected Area.
Drift or fixed net fishing at an ammunition dump is dangerous.
